titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard W. Holm Collection ARS.0114
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Franz Kunst

publicationstmt.p: The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.descrules: Prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection size
physdesc.extent: : 40 open reel tapes (4 5" reels ; 36 7" reels) ; 3 audiocassettes ; 2 videocassettes

did.abstract: A small collection of science-related recordings donated by Stanford biologist Richard Holm. Includes tapes from the American Association for the Advancement of Science annual meeting in Dallas, Texas, and broadcasts from the Pacifica Tape Archive.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research; material must be requested at least two business days in advance of intended use. Contact the Archive for assistance.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with repository. Publication and reproduction rights reside with the creators or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Head Librarian of the Archive of Recorded Sound.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Holm Collection, ARS-0114. Courtesy of the Stanford Archive of Recorded Sound, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

processinfo.head: Sponsor
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced with generous financial support from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Richard W. Holm (1925-1987) was a noted professor of biology at Stanford University. This is a small collection donated by Holm of science-related recordings, including several tapes from sessions at the American Association for the Advancement of Science annual meeting in Dallas, Texas in 1968, three Pacifica Tape Archive broadcasts, and what appears to be some recordings of animal sounds.

did.unittitle: American Association for the Advancement of Science Annual Meeting, Dallas Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audio from the following sessions: Use of Space By Animals and Men (12 tapes) ; Global Effects of Environmental Pollution (8 tapes) ; Unanticipated Environmental Hazards (4 tapes) ; Latin American Development (2 tapes) ; Research For the World Food Crisis (4 tapes).

did.unittitle: Beecher, William and Marguerite. 37. Beyond Success And Failure. Educational Technology Division
Bio Core Advisory Board. Swift, Edgar, Ehrlich, Holm [Stanford Core Biology board meeting]
Charter, S.P.R. For Unto Us a Child is Born: A Human Ecological Overview of Population-Pressures (Man On Earth, SPR Charter, Olema, California)
Cricket ; Cicadas ; Katydids ; Fish ; Amphibians ; Chickens ; Penguins
Hoffer, Eric. The Temper of Eric Hoffer. P-23 (Pacifica Tape Library)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hoffer talks With Byron Bryant about his self-styled philosophy.

did.unittitle: Huxley, Aldous. Visionary Experience Lecture at Monterey Peninsula College. P-33. (Pacifica Tape Library)
Side 1. Huxley - Darwin Cent. Side 2. Alan Watts
Mead, Margaret. Sexual Freedom and Cultural Change. P-4 (Pacifica Tape Archive)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mead speaking at a public forum held in San Francisco called The Pill and The Puritan Ethic.

did.unittitle: [unidentified, but loose notes suggest these may be animal sounds]
